techmeme.title: Sources: Apple's overhaul of Siri faces engineering problems and software bugs; some features, planned for April, may have to be postponed until May or later (Mark Gurman/Bloomberg)
OpenAI's board rejects the $97.4B bid by Elon Musk and a consortium of investors, saying they reject "Musk's latest attempt to disrupt his competition" (Cade Metz/New York Times)
Meta announces Project Waterworth, a subsea cable project that will span over 50,000 km and connect five continents (Ingrid Lunden/TechCrunch)
Google deactivates an Android feature that crowdsources device sensor data to provide earthquake warnings in Brazil after mistakenly sending notifications (Taylor Kerns/Android Police)
Source: xAI is canvassing potential investors, including Sequoia Capital and a16z, for a roughly $10B funding round that would value the company at about $75B (Gillian Tan/Bloomberg)
